snippet: Limits on gun possession in France means that we can go about our daily lives without fear of being shot at school, stores or movie theaters.
abstract: Mira Kamdar Editorial Observer contrasts tight gun regulations in France, where 140 people died from gun homicides in 2012 with those in America, where gun homicides killed 11,622 in same year; cites her mother, who lives near Roseburg, Ore, as example of gun owner fed up with carnage and lack of gun control legislation.
lead_paragraph: Limits on gun possession in France means that we can go about our daily lives without fear of being shot at school, stores or movie theaters.

headline.print_headline: America’s Gun Madness, as Seen From Europe
headline.main: America’s Gun Madness, as Seen From Europe
